product_description: Kathmandu, the largest city of Nepal, is the political as well as cultural capital of the country. Kathmandu is a city where ancient traditions rub shoulders with the latest technological advances.  Retaining its ancient traditions, Kathmandu is blessed by a Living Goddess and is enriched by endless ceremonial processions and events that take to the streets every now and then with throngs of devotees seeking blessings. The Newari civilization of the Kathmandu Valley has a rich aesthetic and cultural legacy. Intricate wood carvings, distinctive temples, sculptures, bronze crafts, terracotta works, and the unique lifestyle of its people still thrive at. It is a living example of how cultural restoration and tourism can complement each other, leading to the preservation of historical artifacts and the growth of rich cultural history.
outlined_itinerary: Day 01: Arrival in Kathmandu and Overnight
Day 02: Full Day Kathmandu Sightseeing and Overnight
Day 03: Day Trip to Chandragiri Hills
Day 04: Departure

detailed_itinerary.title: Arrive in Kathmandu
detailed_itinerary.description: Once you arrive at the Tribhuvan International Airport in Kathmandu, look out for our representative who will be holding a placard with your name on it. A short drive and you will be in your hotel, Our tour officer will help you complete all the check-in procedure and brief you about tour itinerary. Overnight stay in Kathmandu.

detailed_itinerary.title: Full Day Kathmandu Sightseeing
detailed_itinerary.description: Enjoy your morning breakfast. Today, you will start a journey of cultural exploration! Starting from Kathmandu, the nerve center of Nepal, we will arrange a variety of sightseeing activities for you.  Begin your tour with Swayambhunath Temple also known as the Monkey Temple. Resting on a hillock 3 km west of Kathmandu, Swayambhu is one of the holiest Buddhist stupas in Nepal. It is said to have evolved spontaneously when the valley was created out of a ancient lake more than 2,000 years ago. This stupa is the oldest of its kind in Nepal and has numerous shrines and monasteries on its premises.

detailed_itinerary.title: DAY TRIP TO CHANDRAGIRI
detailed_itinerary.description: Enjoy your morning breakfast. Today are going to have a full day fun trip to chandragiri.  It’s about 1 hour drive to reach Chandragiri Hills from Kathmandu. Chandragiri hill, the place to have a view of the Kathmandu valley and to have the impression of seeing all of Nepal. On a clear day, you can have a panorama of the magnificent Himalayan chains from Annapurna to Everest. Take a cable car ride to reach at the top of Chandragiri. Enjoy the scenic view along the way. Once you reach on top visit Bhaleshwor Temple, situated in the southwest side of Hills. Enjoy break taking views of the himalayas. Return back in cable car, drive back to your hotel and remaining time at leisure in Kathamndu..  Overnight in Kathmadu.

detailed_itinerary.title: Departure Transfer
detailed_itinerary.description: After breakfast, our cheerful representative will drop you off to the airport three hours prior to the flight departure. The mystic land of the Himalayas holds many more secrets to be told. Come back again for another adventure visiting our spectacular mountains

tour_cost_includes: Airport pickup/drop using private vehicle
03 nights accommodation on Double/Twin sharing basis at hotel in Kathmandu
All sightseeing transfers using private a/c vehicle
Daily Breakfast at hotel
Mineral Water on board during sightseeing tour
All applicable taxes.
tour_cost_excludes: Airfare to/from Nepal.
Beverage and expenses of personal nature.

Personal Insurance.

product_description: Kathmandu, the largest city of Nepal, is the political as well as cultural capital of the country. Kathmandu is a city where ancient traditions rub shoulders with the latest technological advances. Kathmandu Valley has a rich aesthetic and cultural legacy. Intricate wood carvings, distinctive temples, sculptures, bronze crafts, terracotta works, and the unique lifestyle of its people still thrive at. Nestled on the northern fringe of the Kathmandu Valley, Nagarkot is a captivating destination. This idyllic hill station boasts unparalleled natural beauty and offers enchanting sunrise views over the Himalayas.
outlined_itinerary: Day 01: Arrival in Kathmandu and Overnight.
Day 02: Full Day Kathmandu Sightseeing and Overnight
Day 03: Drive to Nagarkot, Enroute Bhaktapur and Overnight
Day 04: Departure

detailed_itinerary.title: Arrive in Kathmandu
detailed_itinerary.description: Once you arrive at the Tribhuvan International Airport in Kathmandu, look out for our representative who will be holding a placard with your name on it. A short drive and you will be in your hotel, our tour officer will help you complete all the check-in procedure and brief you about tour itinerary. Overnight stay in Kathmandu.

detailed_itinerary.title: Full day Kathmandu sightseeing
detailed_itinerary.description: Enjoy your morning breakfast. Today, you will start a journey of cultural exploration! Starting from Kathmandu, the nerve center of Nepal, we will arrange a variety of sightseeing activities for you.  Begin your tour with the holiest Pashupatinath Temple.  According to religious beliefs, Lord Pashupatinath is the almighty God and the savior of all mankind. Therefore, it is said that all Hindus should make a pilgrimage to the Pashupatinath temple at least once in their lives to pray for eternal peace and salvation.Then visit to Swayambhunath Temple also known as the Monkey Temple. Resting on a hillock 3 km west of Kathmandu, Swayambhu is one of the holiest Buddhist stupas in Nepal. It is said to have evolved spontaneously when the valley was created out of a primordial lake more than 2,000 years ago. This stupa is the oldest of its kind in Nepal and has numerous shrines and monasteries on its premises.In the afternoon visit Boudhanath Stupa, the largest Buddhist stupa in the world, built in the fifth century. Before today's stupa was built, it was a campsite for Tibetan merchants. Today, it is the best place to observe Tibetan lifestyle, culture and religious activities of monks. It is also rich in Tibetan products such as Tibetan jewelry, hand-woven carpets, thangkas, masks, kukuli, knives and other Tibetan products.In the evening proceed Patan Durbar Square & Golden Temple. Patan is one of the oldest Buddhist cities. It is a center of both Hinduism and Buddhism with 136 bahals or courtyards and 55 major temples.  Most of these structures are in the vicinity of the Durbar Square. The Golden Temple with literal meaning "Gold-colored Great Monastery,", is a historical vihara (Buddhist monastery) situated in Patan. Overnight in Kathmandu

detailed_itinerary.title: Drive to Nagarkot, enroute Bhaktapur
detailed_itinerary.description: Enjoy your morning breakfast. Check out of your hotel and drive to Nagarkot (32km, 1.5 hrs. drive). Enroute Visit Bhaktapur . After breakfast check out and head for your Bhaktapur sightseeing. Bhaktapur, commonly known as the “city of worshippers,” is also known as the “city of temples.” Visit, Bhaktapur Durbar Square, ancient temples and shrines, sculptures and historical heritage sites constructed in different eras carry the identity of this city. Highlights of the ancient’s Nepali art like golden gate, 55 Window Temple, etc. can be observed in one place here. Nagarkot is known for its spectacular sunrise and sunset views. Nagarkot is believed to be a rich home for different species of butterflies. The hill-town even offers a panoramic view of the entire Kathmandu Valley Check in at your hotel and enjoy the remaining day at leisure.  Overnight in Nagarkot.

detailed_itinerary.title: Departure transfer
detailed_itinerary.description: Enjoy sunrise over the panoramic view of Himalayas from hotel premises (if weather Permits). After breakfast, our cheerful representative will drop you off to the airport three hours prior to the flight departure. The mystic land of the Himalayas holds many more secrets to be told. Come back again for another adventure visiting our spectacular mountains

detailed_itinerary.title: Arrive in Gorakhpur & transfer to Lumbini
detailed_itinerary.description: Once you arrive at Gorakhpur, Please call our driver & he will transfer you to the Lumbini hotel (3 hrs). Arrive Lumbini hotel, Check into the hotel , Get refreshed & proceed for sightseeing covering :- Maya devi temple, Monastries & Ashoka Pillar. Back to hotel  & Overnight

detailed_itinerary.title: drive to Pokhara
detailed_itinerary.description: Following breakfast, our adventure begins road trip to Pokhara (7 hrs approx.). Pokhara, the 'Tourist Capital of Nepal,' at an altitude of more than 900m, it is one of the highest cities, making it the base for many world-famous treks. The highlight of the town is its Lakeside, which is a boating paradise flanked with charming shops, dreamy cafés, restaurants and pubs that make up this postcard-perfect town. Once you arrive in Pokhara transfer to designated hotel and check-in. Feel free to take a stroll through the city in the evening or relax by the lakeside. Overnight in Pokhara

detailed_itinerary.title: half day Pokhara sightseeing
detailed_itinerary.description: Enjoy your morning breakfast at hotel. Then proceed for your sightseeing. Visit to Bindhabasini Temple dedicated to goddess Durga- the deity of supreme power, right in the center of the bazaar. The 16th century architecture is sure to delight you. Davis falls, or “Patale Changgo” in Nepali is actually an underground waterfall. The water flows under the ground through its natural tunnel of 500 feet from the fall made by the water currents beneath the land. Move towards Mahadev Cave, also known as Gupteshwor Cave is limestone cave with its shrine desiccated to Lord Shiva.  The cave is said to have been discovered in 16th Century. Watch the Seti Gorge standing atop the Mahendra Pul. Flowing right through the city, the river runs completely underground at places. Also, visit World Peace Pagoda, situated at the height of 1100 meters on the Anadu Hill. After returning back to lakeside, hop on the boat for an hour boat ride in Fewa Lake. Overnight in Pokhara.

detailed_itinerary.title: drive to Kathmandu
detailed_itinerary.description: After Breakfast, we take a long drive to Kathmandu (9 hrs). Enroute visit Manakamana Temple (Optional). Upon arrival in Kathmandu check in at your hotel and relax the remaining time of your own at leisure. Overnight in Kathmandu

detailed_itinerary.title: Full day Kathmandu sightseeing
detailed_itinerary.description: Enjoy your morning breakfast. Today, you will start a journey of cultural exploration! Starting from Kathmandu, the nerve center of Nepal, we will arrange a variety of sightseeing activities for you.  Begin your tour with the holiest Pashupatinath Temple.  According to religious beliefs, Lord Pashupatinath is the almighty God and the savior of all mankind. Therefore, it is said that all Hindus should make a pilgrimage to the Pashupatinath temple at least once in their lives to pray for eternal peace and salvation.Then visit to Swayambhunath Temple also known as the Monkey Temple. Resting on a hillock 3 km west of Kathmandu, Swayambhu is one of the holiest Buddhist stupas in Nepal. It is said to have evolved spontaneously when the valley was created out of a primordial lake more than 2,000 years ago. This stupa is the oldest of its kind in Nepal and has numerous shrines and monasteries on its premises.In the afternoon visit Boudhanath Stupa, the largest Buddhist stupa in the world, built in the fifth century. Before today's stupa was built, it was a campsite for Tibetan merchants. Today, it is the best place to observe Tibetan lifestyle, culture and religious activities of monks. It is also rich in Tibetan products such as Tibetan jewelry, hand-woven carpets, thangkas, masks, kukuli, knives and other Tibetan products.In the evening proceed Patan Durbar Square & Golden Temple. Patan is one of the oldest Buddhist cities. It is a center of both Hinduism and Buddhism with 136 bahals or courtyards and 55 major temples.  Most of these structures are in the vicinity of the Durbar Square. The Golden Temple with literal meaning "Gold-colored Great Monastery," is a historical vihara (Buddhist monastery) situated in Patan. Overnight in Kathmandu.

detailed_itinerary.title: Drive to Lumbini
detailed_itinerary.description: After Breakfast, Check out from the Kathmandu hotel & drop to Lumbini (10 HRS). Arrive Lumbini, Check into the lumbini hotel & Overnight

detailed_itinerary.title: Departure
detailed_itinerary.description: After breakfast free time until departure. Our tour escort will timely drop you to airport 3 hour prior flight time for final departure. The mystic land of the Himalayas holds many more secrets to be told. Come back again for another adventure visiting our spectacular mountains.

product_description: Himalayan Trio as the name suggests it covers two most popular valley tour of the country, Kathmandu and Pokhara. This tour is a fine blend of religion, culture and nature. Kathmandu- the city of temples covers core religious and historically important UNESCO World Heritage sites; where travelers can understand culture and lifestyle of Nepalese people. This tour also covers Pokhara - known as Switzerland of Asia which gives magnificent view of western Himalayan ranges including Mt Fishtail, Annapurna, Dhaulagiri and other mountain peaks, lakes, waterfall, etc. Also Muktinath is a Vishnu temple, sacred to both Hindus and Buddhists. It is located in Muktinath Valley at the foot of the Thorong La mountain pass in Mustang, Nepal. It is one of the world's highest temples. Within Hinduism, it is one of the 108 Divya Desams, and is the only Divya Desam located outside India. Beside the popular Pilgrimage, nature and cultural site tour, during this tour one can be involved in various adventure activity, night life, casinos, discotheques, shopping, etc.
outlined_itinerary: Day 01: Arrival in Tribhuvan International airport
Day 02: Kathmandu sightseeing tour
Day 03: Drive to Pokhara
Day 04: Fly Jomsom & sightseeing
Day 05: Fly Pokhara & sightseeing tour
Day 06: Drive back Kathmandu
Day 07: International departure

detailed_itinerary.title: Arrive in Kathmandu
detailed_itinerary.description: Once you arrive at the Tribhuvan International Airport in Kathmandu, look out for our representative who will be holding a placard with your name on it. A short drive and you will be in your hotel, our tour officer will help you complete all the check-in procedure and brief you about tour itinerary. In the evening you can head over to Thamel, the main tourist hub where you can have some good time at the bar or a club on own. Overnight stay in Kathmandu.

detailed_itinerary.title: Kathmandu City Tour
detailed_itinerary.description: Today you get to kick-start your cultural discovery! Visit Pashupatinath Temple, Boudhanath Stupa, Patan Durbar Square, Swoyambhunath Stupa, and more. The day is filled with cultural landmarks of Kathmandu. Overnight in Kathmandu.

detailed_itinerary.title: Drive to Pokhara
detailed_itinerary.description: Following breakfast, our adventure begins with a scenic drive to Pokhara (210km, 7-8 hrs drive) offering views of rivers, terrace fields, and captivating views of the Annapurna range. Optional visit to Manakamana Devi Temple by cable car. Overnight in Pokhara.

detailed_itinerary.title: Fly to Jomsom & Drive Muktinath
detailed_itinerary.description: Early morning transfer to airport for flight to Jomsom. Drive to Muktinath for the temple visit. Return to Jomsom. Overnight in Jomsom.

detailed_itinerary.title: Fly back to Pokhara & Sightseeing Tour
detailed_itinerary.description: Fly back to Pokhara, visit Bindabasini Temple, Davis Falls, Mahadev Cave, and Seti Gorge. Stroll the lakeside area in the evening. Overnight in Pokhara.

detailed_itinerary.title: Drive back to Kathmandu
detailed_itinerary.description: After breakfast, drive back to Kathmandu. Rest of the day free at leisure. Overnight in Kathmandu.

detailed_itinerary.title: Depart Kathmandu
detailed_itinerary.description: Our representative will drop you off at the airport three hours prior to flight departure.

product_description: Wildlife & wonders tour package as a name suggests covering major triangle destinations, Kathmandu, Pokhara and Chitwan. Trip Begins from Kathmandu- the city of temples covers core religious and historically important UNESCO World Heritage sites; where travelers can understand culture and lifestyle of Nepalese people. Then moving forward to Pokhara - known as Switzerland of Asia which gives magnificent view of western Himalayan ranges including Mt Fishtail, Annapurna, Dhaulagiri and other mountain peaks, lakes, waterfall, etc. And Chitwan famous for safari in tropical jungles of the Terai that preserves some of the best wildlife habitat in the subcontinent. It offers exceptional biodiversity and a beautiful natural environment. The tropical jungles of the Terai preserve some of the best wildlife habitat in the subcontinent. Beside the popular nature and cultural site tour, during this tour one can be involved in various adventure activity, night life, casinos, discotheques, shopping, etc.
outlined_itinerary: Day 01: Arrive at Tribhuvan International Airport.
Day 02: Explore Kathmandu's cultural wonders on a sightseeing tour.
Day 03: Drive to Pokhara, enjoying scenic views along the way.
Day 04: Discover the natural beauty of Pokhara on a sightseeing tour.
Day 05: Drive to Chitwan, exploring the wilderness of Flora and Fauna.
Day 06: Experience the jungle activities.
Day 07: Return to Kathmandu by road, savoring the journey back.
Day 08: Departure from Tribhuvan International Airport for your international flight.

detailed_itinerary.title: Arrive in Kathmandu
detailed_itinerary.description: Upon your arrival at Tribhuvan International Airport in Kathmandu, keep an eye out for our representative holding a placard with your name. They will assist you to the hotel, where our tour officer will help with the check-in process and provide a briefing about the tour itinerary. In the evening, you can visit Thamel, the main tourist hub, and enjoy some time at a bar or club own your own. Have a comfortable overnight stay in Kathmandu.

detailed_itinerary.title: Kathmandu City Tour
detailed_itinerary.description: After Breakfast we begin our cultural discovery in Kathmandu, the heart of Nepal. We'll visit the Pashupatinath Temple, a sacred place where Lord Pashupatinath is worshipped for eternal peace and salvation. Next, we'll see the impressive Boudhanath Stupa, a large stupa with a vibrant Tibetan culture around it. Moving on, we'll explore Patan Durbar Square, a hub of fine art, with charming alleys and beautiful temples. Finally, we'll visit Swayambhunath Stupa, also known as the "Monkey Temple," famous for its resident monkey population. After a fulfilling day, we'll return to the hotel in Kathmandu for an overnight stay.

detailed_itinerary.title: Drive to Pokhara
detailed_itinerary.description: After breakfast, get ready for an exciting adventure as we travel through on a scenic drive to Pokhara, covering a distance of 210 kilometers, which will take approximately 6 to 7 hours. Along the way, you'll be treated to mesmerizing views of rivers, terraced fields, and as you approach Pokhara, the captivating sight of the Annapurna range will amaze you. Pokhara is renowned for its scenic beauty, often referred to as the "lake city" Once we reach Pokhara, you can enjoy a leisurely stroll through the city in the evening, soaking in the charming atmosphere. Alternatively, you can relax by the serene lakeside, taking in the picturesque views. Overnight, you'll be staying in Pokhara, ready to explore its wonders the next day

detailed_itinerary.title: Sarangkot with Pokhara sightseeing tour
detailed_itinerary.description: In the morning, we'll take a short drive to Sarangkot, a hilltop viewpoint known for its mesmerizing sunrise views. From here, you'll be treated to the awe-inspiring sight of the Annapurna, Dhaulagiri, and Manaslu mountain ranges bathed in golden sunlight. After returning to the hotel and enjoying a delicious breakfast, our sightseeing adventure in Pokhara continues. First, we'll visit the Bindhabasini Temple, an important religious site dedicated to the goddess Durga, offering a peaceful and spiritual ambiance. Next, we'll head to Davis Falls, also known as "PataleChanggo," where you can witness the spectacular underground waterfall created by water currents flowing beneath the land. The sight of the water disappearing into the depths is truly fascinating. Our exploration continues with a visit to Mahadev Cave, also called Gupteshwor Cave, a limestone cave housing a shrine dedicated to Lord Shiva. The cave's ancient history and religious significance make it a unique and intriguing destination. Before the day comes to a close, we'll stop at the Seti Gorge, where the Seti River flows through the city. At certain points, the river disappears underground, creating a mystical and picturesque setting. In the evening, you'll have the delightful experience of a 01-hour boat ride on Fewa Lake, taking you to Taal Barahi Temple. After a satisfying day of exploration, you'll have a comfortable overnight stay in Pokhara.

detailed_itinerary.title: Drive to Chitwan
detailed_itinerary.description: Drive towards Chitwan (180 km, 4-5 hrs drive). Chitwan is listed among one of the eight UNESCO world heritage sites. This is also the first national park of Nepal. You will enjoy 2 days full of jungle activities that will take you deep into the jungle and get closer to the wild as you comb the jungles for rhinos and tigers. On the evening there will be special cultural show by indigenous Tharu community people followed by dinner. Overnight stay at Chitwan.

detailed_itinerary.title: Jungle Activity in Chitwan National Park
detailed_itinerary.description: The day will be filled with various jungle activities starting with jungle safari. Canoeing on the calm waters of Rapti River is the best way to spot water birds, crocodiles and alligators. Visit local Tharu village to closely observe the lifestyle and habitat of these indigenous people; and the brave can even take a guided walk through the jungle, surrounded by the hoots and roars of the forest. Overnight stay at Chitwan.

detailed_itinerary.title: Drive back to Kathmandu
detailed_itinerary.description: After breakfast, we'll begin our journey back to Kathmandu. The scenic drive will take you through beautiful landscapes and provide a chance to relish the memories of your time in Pokhara and Chitwan. Once we reach Kathmandu, we'll transfer you to your respective hotel. The rest of the day is free for you to relax and enjoy some leisure time.

detailed_itinerary.title: Depart Kathmandu
detailed_itinerary.description: Our representative will drop you off at the airport three hours before your flight departure. We hope you enjoyed your time in the Himalayas and invite you to return for another adventure, exploring the spectacular mountains and more of Nepal's wonders. Safe travels!

product_description: Nepal’s Grand Tour Package is classic tour covering major triangle destinations, Kathmandu, Pokhara, Chitwan & Nagarkot. Trip begin from Kathmandu- the city of temples covers core religious and historically important UNESCO World Heritage sites; where travelers can understand culture and lifestyle of Nepalese people. Then moving forward to Pokhara - known as Switzerland of Asia which gives magnificent view of western Himalayan ranges including Mt Fishtail, Annapurna, Dhaulagiri and other mountain peaks, lakes, waterfall, etc. Chitwan famous for safari in tropical jungles of the Terai that preserves some of the best wildlife habitat in the subcontinent. It offers exceptional biodiversity and a beautiful natural environment. The tropical jungles of the Terai preserve some of the best wildlife habitat in the subcontinent. And Nagarkot one of the hill station nearby Kathmandu valley where you can witness the panoramic mountain view of eastern mountain Including Mt. Everest and green high hills surrounding the valley. Beside the popular nature and cultural site tour, during this tour one can be involved in various adventure activity, night life, casinos, discotheques, shopping, etc.

detailed_itinerary.description: After breakfast, get ready for an exciting adventure as we travel through on a scenic drive to Pokhara, covering a distance of 210 kilometers, which will take approximately 6 to 7 hours. Along the way, you'll be treated to mesmerizing views of rivers, terraced fields, and as you approach Pokhara, the captivating sight of the Annapurna range will amaze you. Pokhara is renowned for its scenic beauty, often referred to as the "lake city" Once we reach Pokhara, you can enjoy a leisurely stroll through the city in the evening, soaking in the charming atmosphere. Alternatively, you can relax by the serene lakeside, taking in the picturesque views. Overnight, you'll be staying in Pokhara, ready to explore its wonders the next day

detailed_itinerary.title: Sarangkot with Pokhara sightseeing tour
detailed_itinerary.description: In the morning, we'll take a short drive to Sarangkot, a hilltop viewpoint known for its mesmerizing sunrise views. From here, you'll be treated to the awe-inspiring sight of the Annapurna, Dhaulagiri, and Manaslu mountain ranges bathed in golden sunlight. After returning to the hotel and enjoying a delicious breakfast, our sightseeing adventure in Pokhara continues. First, we'll visit the Bindhabasini Temple, an important religious site dedicated to the goddess Durga, offering a peaceful and spiritual ambiance. Next, we'll head to Davis Falls, also known as "PataleChanggo," where you can witness the spectacular underground waterfall created by water currents flowing beneath the land. The sight of the water disappearing into the depths is truly fascinating. Our exploration continues with a visit to Mahadev Cave, also called Gupteshwor Cave, a limestone cave housing a shrine dedicated to Lord Shiva. The cave's ancient history and religious significance make it a unique and intriguing destination. Before the day comes to a close, we'll stop at the Seti Gorge, where the Seti River flows through the city. At certain points, the river disappears underground, creating a mystical and picturesque setting. In the evening, you'll have the delightful experience of a 01-hour boat ride on Fewa Lake, taking you to Taal Barahi Temple. After a satisfying day of exploration, you'll have a comfortable overnight stay in Pokhara.

detailed_itinerary.title: Drive to Chitwan
detailed_itinerary.description: Drive towards Chitwan (180 km, 4-5 hrs drive). Chitwan is listed among one of the eight UNESCO world heritage sites. This is also the first national park of Nepal. You will enjoy 2 days full of jungle activities that will take you deep into the jungle and get closer to the wild as you comb the jungles for rhinos and tigers. On the evening there will be special cultural show by indigenous Tharu community people followed by dinner. Overnight stay at Chitwan.

detailed_itinerary.title: Jungle Activity in Chitwan National Park
detailed_itinerary.description: The day will be filled with various jungle activities starting with jungle safari. Canoeing on the calm waters of Rapti River is the best way to spot water birds, crocodiles and alligators. Visit local Tharu village to closely observe the lifestyle and habitat of these indigenous people; and the brave can even take a guided walk through the jungle, surrounded by the hoots and roars of the forest. Overnight stay at Chitwan.

detailed_itinerary.title: Drive back to Kathmandu and transfer to Nagarkot
detailed_itinerary.description: After breakfast drive back to Kathmandu. Upon arriving, transfer to Nagarkot. Nagarkot is 32 KM from Kathmandu and 1:30 min of driving. Nagarkot is one of the nearest hill stations from Kathmandu. Upon arrival followed by welcome drinks check in at hotel and Evening enjoys the panoramic view of eastern mountain ranges with green high hills from your respective hotel & Overnight in Nagarkot

detailed_itinerary.title: Depart Kathmandu
detailed_itinerary.description: Our cheerful representative will drop you off to the airport three hours prior to the flight departure. The mystic land of the Himalayas holds many more secrets to be told. Come back again for another adventure visiting our spectacular mountains.
